body.name: Lexar E32C 128GB Type-C USB Flash Drive, USB-A&USB-C 3.2 Gen 1 Dual Drive OTG 100MB/s Read, Thumb Drive Swivel Design Jump Drive for USB 3.0/2.0, Memory Stick for Android Smartphone, Laptop, PC
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 9 hrs 54 mins
features: High Speed - With read speeds up to 100MB/s, Lexar USB3.2 Gen 1 Flash Drive offers you a nice experience of everyday fast data/files transfer, which makes you save more time. (Based on internal test condition of Lexar, actual speed may vary with different host devices and environments.)

Plug and Play - Lexar USB 3.2 Gen 1 Flash Drive with USB-A & Type-C simple plugs thumb drive then start to transfer and storage data between devices. There is no need to install any software that you can transfer digital files, pictures, music and videos easily in fast speed. If plug, it works. Easy and convenient!

Compatibility – With USB Type-C connector, Lexar USB3.2 Gen 1 USB stick free up storage of your Android smartphone, tablets, computers and any mobile devices with USB Type-C or On The Go (OTG) feature. And it is compatible with Windows7/8/10/Vista/XP/Unix/2000/ME/NT Linux/Mac OS. For devices, Lexar USB 3.2 Gen 1 pen drive is compatible with USB 3.0 and USB 2.0 ports. It can be compatible with more devices to achieve high-speed transmission performance.

Safe and Reliable – With Lexar owned international standard storage technology of shockproof, waterproof, temperature proof (operating range is between 0° C and 60° C and storage range is between -20° C and 85°C.), x-ray proof and magnetic proof, Lexar USB 3.2 Gen 1 Flash Drive constantly safeguards your personal data, and effectively prevents them loss. Lexar is the international brand that worth counting on.

Practical and Portable - With UDP technology, Lexar Type-C USB3.2 Gen 1 Flash Drive in the size of 40.5*12.2*7.2mm and 8g features tiny and seamless outlook with durable and rugged metal Zinc alloy casing and swivel design, which not only helps you keep data in mini size, but also you can be with them by your side. Both reversible USB3.2 Gen 1 (compatible with USB3.0/2.0) and USB C provide more convenience to you to handle different situation when your devices need different connectors support.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for those that have 2 different interface needs!
reviews.reviewText: I recently purchased the Lexar 128GB USB 3.2 Gen 1 Flash Drive and I have been absolutely thrilled with its performance. This is hands down one of the best flash drives that I have ever used, and it has quickly become an essential tool in my digital toolkit.What sets this flash drive apart is its versatility and compatibility. The USB A and USB C/Type C dual drive OTG feature means that it can work with a wide range of devices, including both traditional USB ports and newer USB-C ports. This makes it easy to transfer files between different devices, whether I am using my laptop, tablet, or smartphone.The speed of this flash drive is also truly impressive. With USB 3.2 Gen 1 technology, I can transfer large files in a matter of seconds, which has saved me so much time and hassle compared to using slower, outdated flash drives.Another great feature of this flash drive is its build quality. The materials are high-quality and feel solid and well-made, with no cheap or flimsy parts. It is also compact and portable, which makes it easy to carry with me wherever I go.Overall, I am extremely happy with my purchase of the Lexar 128GB USB 3.2 Gen 1 Flash Drive and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a reliable and versatile flash drive that can handle all of their file transfer needs. It has exceeded my expectations in every way, and I can't imagine ever going back to using a slower or less compatible flash drive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I love this little drive. I was surprised by how small it actually is. It works really well, has lots of space, and gets lost on my desk all of the time because of it’s size. My problem, not Lexar’s! The only issue I have (and I’ve had it with other cards) is the transfer rate from my iPad to the card is sometimes slow. I went from an iPad Air 3rd generation to an iPad 11 Pro 3rd generation and I think it’s a IOS problem. It just cannot handle multiple or large files very well. It times out and I get a “disconnected” error.As is usually the case, I find work arounds, such as using cloud services to back up to (and then download it from there), or compressing video files down to smaller (lower quality). I’ve also learned to take more, shorter, videos than 1 long one. Filming a graduation? Find break points and stop recording, and then start again right away. This breaks up files into smaller ones that are easier to transfer.Anyway, back to the Lexar memory stick. Overall, it works and does what it’s supposed to do. I would recommend it if you need extra storage space for a device with a USB-A or USB-C interface.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It's everything you want in a flashdrive: small, easy to use, superbly well built, fast file transfers, cool color, and both USB-A and USB-C ports, and they both work flawlessly. Everyone should have one of these.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Verified real and fast, but gets concerningly hot
reviews.reviewText: h2testw has confirmed that it's a real drive that matches the advertised capacity and speeds.The drive gets incredibly hot during use though. At the end of the test it was so hot that I had to wait a few minutes to remove it from my laptop because it was genuinely that hot. But that test completely fills the drive and then rapidly reads every file it filled the drive with. So I'd expect it to get hot. In regular use it still gets pretty hot, but not scaldingly hot. But be careful if you're moving a +50gb file over. It might be very hot when it's done moving.I've attached a screenshot from h2testw which shows the verified capacity as well as read and write speeds. The read speeds are 212 megabytes per second and the write speeds are 60 megabytes per second. Both are well above advertised speedsIt's fast, compact, and works on my Windows Laptop, Android Phone, and Steam Deck. The materials seem durable and I like how it has the ability to be attached to keys or a lanyard.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth Your Money
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to replace the trash "2TB" flash drive I bought some time ago. It ended up being a complete waste of money because it corrupted everything, and it wasn't even 2TB.It's fine, but one small trouble with it is that you cannot store videos larger than 4GB. So, don't look forward to moving those extra long HD videos or long 4K UHD videos to it.It's very small and out of the way.The other small, no big big deal, thing about it is it fits a bit too snug into your USB port, so it gets a little scratched. At least mine did.All in all, it was a very good buy, and I do recommend it. It transfers files fairly quickly, and you can connect it directly to your USB-C phone or other device.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Have an old Computer or printer and a new MacBook? This is the drive you have been looking for!
reviews.reviewText: I have an old computer that doesn't have USB C, and I have a brand new Macbook Pro. I can easily move files between my old computer, my all-in-one scanner printer, and my new MBP. Great product, great design.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great keychain flash drive
reviews.reviewText: I’m a copier technician and having this flash drive has made my day-to-day much easier. I’m able to load firmware on the drive from my iPhone to the copier without having to crack open a laptop transfer speeds are fast and have not had compatibility issue across the different manufacturers I work with. If you’re a technician that needs to load different types of firmware, I would recommend this flash drive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Could have been great storage
reviews.reviewText: I like that this thumb drive is both USB and USB C and the fact that it is compact. I attached a keychain to it because I didn't want to lose it.My biggest complaint is it's not a year old (I purchased it in May of 2023) and it stopped working. I use this drive to transfer videos I shoot when I'm in the field. It stopped working last night when I was attempting to edit the video I had on it. I lost everything on the drive which include video for both my YouTube Channels. It's past the return date and I've found no way to get support.Since I can't return it or get customer support I won't be buying anything else with the LEXAR name on it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Seamless Connectivity and Ample Storage – Lexar E32C 128GB Type-C USB Flash Drive is a Game-Changer!
reviews.reviewText: The Lexar E32C 128GB Type-C USB Flash Drive has proven to be a game-changer for my data storage and transfer needs. Its dual USB-A and USB-C 3.2 Gen 1 connectivity make it an incredibly versatile solution, and with a whopping 128GB of storage, it's become an indispensable part of my digital life.The design of this flash drive is not only sleek but also practical. The dual-sided connector means I can effortlessly connect it to both traditional USB-A ports and the newer USB-C ports, making it compatible with a wide range of devices. Whether I'm transferring files between my laptop, smartphone, or tablet, the Lexar E32C ensures a seamless and hassle-free experience.One of the standout features for me is the USB On-The-Go (OTG) capability. This means I can easily connect the flash drive to my Android smartphone or tablet and transfer files on the go. It's like having an additional storage extension for my mobile devices, which is incredibly convenient, especially when I need to offload photos or videos to free up space.The transfer speeds of up to 100MB/s are impressive, ensuring that I can quickly move large files without wasting precious time. Whether it's high-resolution photos, HD videos, or a collection of documents, the Lexar E32C handles it all with ease.The build quality is sturdy, and the compact size allows me to carry it in my pocket or attach it to my keychain using the built-in loop. The drive feels durable, and I appreciate the thoughtful design that prioritizes both functionality and portability.In conclusion, the Lexar E32C 128GB Type-C USB Flash Drive has become an integral part of my digital toolkit. Its dual USB-A and USB-C compatibility, along with the impressive storage capacity and OTG functionality, make it a versatile and reliable choice. If you're in need of a high-performance and flexible flash drive, look no further – the Lexar E32C is a solid investment.
Llebo ya un par de meses con ella excelente producto funcionan bien pequeña nada estorbosa muy buen material 👌 sin ningún problema la recomiendo al 💯
USB-AとC両方使えて便利です。MACとWindows両方で使うときはexFATでフォーマットするといいです。FATでフォーマットすると32GBしか使えなくなります。

Form factor is great, I love the compact swivel design.Impressive speeds, however sustained writes are only around 40MB/s as shown by H2testw (which is still pretty good).I previously owned a 128GB SanDisk dual OTG drive which had painfully slow R/W speeds and so-so build quality, this Lexar is much better.Overall this drive is probably overpriced, but the speed and form factor made it worth it buying for me.
